newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-KLINSMANN GIVES NO CLUES TO FUTURE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-KLINSMANN GIVES NO CLUES TO FUTURE.

text.p: Juergen Klinsmann arrived in Scotland on Monday for two friendlies but the Bayern Munich striker refused to say where he would like to play his soccer next season.
First, Klinsmann, now 32, wants to leading Bayern to the German league and cup double.

"At the end of my first season with Munich we lifted a European trophy (UEFA Cup) and that was followed by Germany winning Euro 96," said Klinsmann. "It wouldn't be a bad way to complete the year with a double for Bayern and it is still possible.
"But it is not right to comment on next season. There has been a lot of speculation.
"I had a few problems in the first part of the season but I guess that is normal too. I have a few possibilities at the end of the season.
"I can stay at Bayern if I want to, I can leave if I want to. My aim is to play a real good second half to the season for Bayern, with the Bundesliga resuming on February 15.
"We are still leading the title race and can win the cup as well. Those are two big aims for me and afterwards I will decide."
Bayern play Raith Rovers on Tuesday and Glasgow Celtic on Wednesday.
